command: [Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol=[Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls12; $ts=Get-Date -Format o; try { $headers=@{ 'Authorization'="Token $env:GREYNOISE_TOKEN"; 'Accept'='application/json' }; $r=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri 'https://api.greynoise.io/v3/community/198.51.100.10' -Headers $headers -Method Get -ErrorAction Stop; ($r.Content | ConvertFrom-Json | Select-Object ip,classification,noise,link,last_seen | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6) | Out-File -FilePath "$env:TEMP\greynoise_ip_198_51_100_10.json" -Encoding utf8; Add-Content -Path "$env:TEMP\recon.log" -Value "$ts GreyNoise success 198.51.100.10" } catch { Add-Content -Path "$env:TEMP\recon.log" -Value "$ts GreyNoise error: $($_.Exception.Message)" }
explanation: Queries GreyNoise (account-gated) for intelligence on a specific IP using token-based authentication to understand exposure/noise characteristics, saving structured results and logging activity.
rationale_steps: Use token-based header to access a closed threat intel source.
Request IP intelligence from the community endpoint.
Persist selected fields as JSON to minimize noise.
Log success/failure with timestamps for traceability.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with properly balanced quotes, parentheses, and braces, correct use of semicolons as statement separators, valid parameter names, and proper error handling with try-catch.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with the T1597 technique by querying GreyNoise (a closed threat intelligence source) using API token authentication, processing the response data, and logging the activity - all consistent with searching closed sources for threat intelligence.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, using correct PowerShell syntax for variable assignments, hash tables, cmdlets, pipelines, and error handling, with no discernible errors.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly achieves the claimed intent by querying GreyNoise, an account-gated (closed) source requiring token authentication, to gather intelligence on an IP address, directly aligning with the T1597 technique's description.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed PowerShell with balanced quotes/braces, valid cmdlets, proper separators, and a correct try/catch structure.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It queries a closed, account-gated GreyNoise API using token auth, processes JSON, and logs/output results consistent with T1597, though the header scheme and use of a documentation IP may limit actual success.
